content.description:
Traverse good holds right to left along the trailside face to a vertical finish on blocky holds. A little pumpy for the grade (about 5.9 or so).

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #76, Unnamed Traverse.
content.location: West face of the boulder and right next to the trail.

content.description:
Climbs the slightly overhanging face with a crux start on thin holds that get progressively better higher as you work right to the lip. Finishes with an easy rockover onto the slabby top.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #75, Unnamed.
content.location:
Right of center on the north side and just right of

Tourist Trap

.

content.description:
Start from blocky pinches and work straight up on edges and slopers to a finishing jug.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Center of the north side and just left of

Tourist Treat

.

content.description: The obvious black slab is climbed on the left side and features balancy movement for most of it's length - a good problem to work on footwork.
content.location: Center of the narrow east face and visible on the approach from the Ranger Station.

content.description:
Sit start as for Road Kill. Traverse right on crimpers and side pulls to top out on Tourist Treat.

Getting of the ground is a bit powerful, but the crux is probably spanning the gap with no feet to get into the jug at the base of Tourist Treat.
content.protection: Pads are useful. A spotter for the top out maybe...
content.location: Sit start to far to the left of Tourist Treat on sharp crimpers.

content.description:
This line follows an arete to the right of Slab Problem V1.

Sit start just to the right of the south side arete on sharp crimpers. Move left on side pulls and crimpers into a sloper dish on the arete for the left hand and a blank hold for the right. Throw a left heel hook around the corner and squeeze the rock to make a series of left hand compression bumps all the way up to a thin ledge. Top out on ledges slightly up and right.

This might be a reach problem, but alternative beta seems possible. The crux is probably making the last bump to the upper hold.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. I cleaned up most of the choss and grains, but there is still the possibility for bad rock.
content.location: South side of Ranger Station Rock #2 to the right Slab Problem (V1), and to the left of Tourist Treat (V0). Sit start on thin crimpers of the left and right hand.

content.description: Starts on head high crimps left of Slab Problem V1. Moves right along the arete/slap.
